feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operational reality summary for "daily wage calculator" based on Jira evidence: - Findings / issues / limitations: 3 - Troubleshooting / edge cases / requests: 2 - Evidence includes UI/visibility or copy/label concerns.

findings.group_description: The daily wage calculator has multiple precision and calculation nuances that can lead to unexpected results across different scenarios.
findings.issue_explanation: Calculation methods for daily wage involve complex logic around divisors, leap years, and configuration settings that can produce slight variations in expected outcomes.
findings.limitation_statement: The system lacks transparent, configurable calculation methods for daily wage computations across different use cases.
findings.gap_statement: Need for more flexible daily wage calculation configurations and clearer documentation of calculation methodologies.

findings.group_description: The system inconsistently handles leap year calculations in service duration and daily wage computations.
findings.issue_explanation: Leap years are not consistently processed, causing minor discrepancies in gratuity and service duration calculations.
findings.limitation_statement: Leap year logic is not transparently implemented across different calculation scenarios.
findings.gap_statement: Need for standardized leap year handling in all daily wage and service duration calculations.

findings.group_description: Global configuration settings can unexpectedly override policy-level daily wage calculation methods.
findings.issue_explanation: Users cannot always customize leave deduction calculations due to hidden global configuration precedence.
findings.limitation_statement: Policy-level settings are subordinate to system-wide global configurations.
findings.gap_statement: Need for more transparent configuration hierarchy and user controls in daily wage calculations.

troubleshooting.group_description: When unpaid leave deductions produce unexpected results, manual adjustments might be necessary.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution:
1. Verify global daily rate configuration
2. Check policy-level settings
3. If discrepancy persists, create manual deduction to reconcile differences

troubleshooting.group_description: Manually verify service duration calculations during leap years.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution:
1. Count exact days, accounting for February 29th
2. Divide by 366 for leap years instead of 365
3. Double-check manual calculations against system output

glossary.definition: The number of days used to calculate an employee's daily rate, which can vary between 30, 30.42, or working days depending on system configuration.
Days counted for salary calculations, which may exclude weekends and public holidays based on the employee's work week configuration.
